xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: Manuscript received May 21, 2007. Manuscript received in final form March 23, 2008. First published April 28, 2009; current version published December 23, 2009. Recommended by Associate Editor N. Hovakimyan. This work was supported in part by NSF CAREER Award CMS-0547448, by AFOSR Contracts F49620-03-1-0381 and F49620-03-1-0170, by AFRL Contract FA4819-05-D-0011, and by Research Grant US-3715-05 from BARD, the United States–Israel Binational Agricultural Research and Development Fund at the University of Florida, Gainesville.

organization.$: Department of Mechanical and Nuclear Engineering
Department of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering

head.citation-title: Adaptive homography-based visual servo tracking control via a quaternion formulation
head.abstracts: In this paper, an adaptive homography-based visual servo tracking controller is developed for the camera-in-hand problem using a quaternion formulation to represent rotation tracking error. The desired trajectory in the tracking problem is encoded by a sequence of images (e.g., a video sequence), and Lyapunov methods are employed to facilitate the control design and the stability analysis. An adaptive estimation law is designed to compensate for the lack of unknown depth information. Experimental results are provided to demonstrate the performance of the visual servo tracking controller. Â© 2009 IEEE.

organization.$: Department of Mechanical and Nuclear Engineering
